annotations.description: It was a good decision to watch today's encounter. There has been more to see on the pitch than in most of the other games. Barcelona had more of the game and were superior. Their manager will certainly be the happier of the two managers. In terms of strategy, the hosts were waiting for the right moment to win the ball and launch a counter attack. The visiting side adopted a possession style of football.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: That's the end of the match.
Some great controlled play and passing in the middle of the pitch from Barcelona.
should know this behaviour is beyond the rules. He was too careless with his challenge and left Carlos Clos Gomez no option but to blow his whistle.

annotations.description: Goal! Luis Suarez (Barcelona) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 0:8.

annotations.label: soccer-ball

Jordi Alba (Barcelona) did his best to latch on to a crossfield pass, but it was too long and it goes out of play.

Ambitious effort from Florin Andone (Cordoba). He finds himself in a great position after collecting a precise pass inside the penalty area and goes for goal, but it never troubles the goalkeeper and flies well over the bar.
What a big chance! Luis Suarez (Barcelona) picks up an inch perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post.
latches on to an accurate pass inside the box and immediately unleashes a shot towards goal, but it goes high over the crossbar.

annotations.label: soccer-ball
annotations.description: It's a goal! Luis Suarez (Barcelona) alters the score to 0:4. He latched on to a good cross into the box from Dani Alves, steering his header from close range off the left post into the back of the net. Martin Juan Carlos was helpless.

annotations.label: soccer-ball
annotations.description: The ball hits the back of the net! Dani Alves showcases his brilliant technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box. Lionel Messi (Barcelona) gets onto the scoresheet by sweetly heading it low inside the left post – 0:3.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: Carlos Clos Gomez blows his whistle and the second half starts.

Well, it hasn't been the most exciting game in the world but there has been some nice football on display. We hope that the second period will bring more action. Barcelona have arguably been the better of the two sides in the first half. The home side is creating their opportunities using lightning fast counter attacks. The tactic of the away side is slow build up play.

annotations.label: whistle
annotations.description: That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.

Hello, welcome to our live play by play commentaries. You will be able to see a written form of all the interesting moments of the game, so you won't miss a thing. Sit back and have fun.

It was a good decision to watch today's encounter. There has been more to see on the pitch than in most of the other games. Barcelona had more of the game and were superior. Their manager will certainly be the happier of the two managers. In terms of strategy, the hosts were waiting for the right moment to win the ball and launch a counter attack. The visiting side adopted a possession style of football.
